intro: Marattia chiricana, commonly known as the Chiriquí fern, is a species of tree fern native to Central America. It belongs to the family Marattiaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnate fronds. The plant thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Its fronds can reach lengths of up to 3 meters, making it a striking feature in its natural habitat. Marattia chiricana plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and contributing to forest biodiversity.
